lead_paragraph: School authorities in the town of Therwil said the family of two Syrian brothers could be fined about $5,000 if the teenagers refused to shake their female teacher’s hand on religious grounds.

byline.contributor: Claire Barthelemy contributed reporting from London, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

headline.main: Muslim Boys at a Swiss School Must Shake Teachers’ Hands, Even Female Ones

snippet: School authorities in the town of Therwil said the family of two Syrian brothers could be fined about $5,000 if the teenagers refused to shake their female teacher’s hand on religious grounds.
abstract: Provincial Swiss school board makes morning handshakes between teachers and students mandatory, following two Muslim students' refusal to shake their female teacher's hand; concludes practice is essential part of Swiss social fabric and trumps religious objections; episode unfolds amid Continent-wide anxiety over assimilation of migrants.
